Simone Gbagbo, Côte d'Ivoire's former first lady running for president
subhead: Unlike her ex-husband Laurent Gbagbo, who served as president from 2000 to 2010 and is barred from running, Simone Gbagbo is set to face his former archrival at the polls: President Alassane Ouattara, the clear favorite in the race.

title: Trump openly grants pardons to business allies and political supporters

title: Michel Devoret, 2025 Nobel Prize in Physics laureate, has fun in the quantum tunnel
subhead: Honored by the Swedish Academy alongside his colleagues John Clarke and John Martinis for research conducted 40 years ago, the French scientist now wants to engage with young people to popularize his field.

title: 'The Louvre's stolen jewels, valuable only for their gemstones, are above all outdated and cumbersome'
subhead: Reactions to the Louvre heist ignore the complex equation museums face: offering generous public access while securing cumbersome objects better suited for a bank vault, explains Le Monde columnist Michel Guerrin.

title: Louvre museum director admits jewel heist 'was not inevitable'

title: Fighting their own country: Hundreds of thousands of Ukrainians are forcibly conscripted by Russia
subhead: Moscow is pursuing a policy of forced Russification and militarization in occupied territories, aiming to turn the local population into soldiers. These Ukrainians account for one quarter of the prisoners of war held by Kyiv, Le Monde reveals.
